item.title: Managing Virtual Network Labs with KNE
item.description: This post will be a (very short) introduction to kne, a project from Google that lets you run virtual network topologies in Kubernetes. I’m writing this as the current docs are a bit lacking for anyone who really just wants a lab topology without necessarily understanding how to do things with Kubernetes. Prerequisites To get started, you’ll need a few things: Docker Go kind kubectl Install Docker This is the most complicated step.
